Justification: To assess for the presence of a deep vein thrombosis (DVT) in the calf.
To evaluate for the presence of a clotting disorder, as elevated levels may indicate a DVT.
To check for signs of infection or other underlying conditions that may contribute to swelling and pain.
To provide a more definitive assessment of the venous system in the leg.
To assess for peripheral artery disease, which could also cause leg pain.
